documentation.text:
@dev run this function to make the deposit that starts the latestage bonding curve
@param total the amount of erc20 tokens to transfer into this contract

@dev set the fee users pay in ETH to buy BIOP from the bonding curve
@param newFee_ the new fee (in tenth percent) for buying on the curve

@dev set the fee users pay in ETH to sell BIOP to the bonding curve
@param newFee_ the new fee (in tenth percent) for selling on the curve

arguments.value: Ownable: caller is not the dao

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Ownable: caller is not the dao"

documentation.text: @dev method that returns BIOP amount sold by curve
@dev method that returns curves ETH (reserve) balance

@notice purchase BIOP from the bonding curve. 
the amount you get is based on the amount in the pool and the amount of eth u send.

@notice sell BIOP to the bonding curve
@param amount the amount of BIOP to sell

attributes.text:
@dev run this function to make the deposit that starts the latestage bonding curve
@param total the amount of erc20 tokens to transfer into this contract

@dev set the fee users pay in ETH to buy BIOP from the bonding curve
@param newFee_ the new fee (in tenth percent) for buying on the curve

@dev set the fee users pay in ETH to sell BIOP to the bonding curve
@param newFee_ the new fee (in tenth percent) for selling on the curve

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Ownable: caller is not the dao"

attributes.type: literal_string "Ownable: caller is not the dao"
attributes.value: Ownable: caller is not the dao

attributes.text: @dev method that returns BIOP amount sold by curve
@dev method that returns curves ETH (reserve) balance

@notice purchase BIOP from the bonding curve. 
the amount you get is based on the amount in the pool and the amount of eth u send.

@notice sell BIOP to the bonding curve
@param amount the amount of BIOP to sell

calculatePurchaseReturn(uint256,uint256,.details: given a continuous token supply, reserve token balance, reserve ratio, and a deposit amount (in the reserve token), calculates the return for a given conversion (in the continuous token)    * Formula: Return = _supply * ((1 + _depositAmount / _reserveBalance) ^ (_reserveRatio / MAX_RESERVE_RATIO) - 1)

calculateSaleReturn(uint256,uint256,uint.details: given a continuous token supply, reserve token balance, reserve ratio and a sell amount (in the continuous token), calculates the return for a given conversion (in the reserve token)    * Formula: Return = _reserveBalance * (1 - (1 - _sellAmount / _supply) ^ (1 / (_reserveRatio / MAX_RESERVE_RATIO)))

params._reserveRatio: constant reserve ratio, represented in ppm, 1-1000000
params._sellAmount: sell amount, in the continuous token itself

continuousSupply().details: method that returns BIOP amount sold by curve

open(uint256).details: run this function to make the deposit that starts the latestage bonding curve

params.total: the amount of erc20 tokens to transfer into this contract

reserveBalance().details: method that returns curves ETH (reserve) balance

params.amount: the amount of BIOP to sell

updateBuyFee(uint256).details: set the fee users pay in ETH to buy BIOP from the bonding curve

params.newFee_: the new fee (in tenth percent) for buying on the curve

updateSellFee(uint256).details: set the fee users pay in ETH to sell BIOP to the bonding curve

params.newFee_: the new fee (in tenth percent) for selling on the curve

buy().notice: purchase BIOP from the bonding curve.  the amount you get is based on the amount in the pool and the amount of eth u send.

sell(uint256).notice: sell BIOP to the bonding curve
